alert.note: Alert for Lower Yampa River Basin (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 27 at 8:08PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...An area of showers and thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Moffat, northeastern Uintah and southeastern Daggett Counties through 845 PM MDT... At 807 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking an area of showers and strong thunderstorms 17 miles north of Vernal, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Moffat, northeastern Uintah and southeastern Daggett Counties, including the following locations... Maeser and Naples. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 40 in Utah between mile markers 136 and 162. U.S. Highway 191 in Utah between mile markers 353 and 384. Colorado 318 between mile markers 1 and 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
